meanings.definition: A person who observes or keeps watch.
meanings.sent1: The spotters at the airport help guide the planes safely to the gates.
meanings.sent2: The bird spotters in the park enjoy identifying different species.
meanings.sent3: The spotters at the game cheered loudly whenever they saw a goal.
meanings.sent4: She was like a spotter in the night, always vigilant and watchful.
meanings.sent5: The spotters on the ship scanned the horizon for any signs of danger.

meanings.definition: A device used to detect or identify something.
meanings.sent1: The camera spotter captured clear images of the wildlife in the forest.
meanings.sent2: The radar spotter alerted the team to the approaching storm.
meanings.sent3: The spotter on the security camera caught the thief red-handed.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like spotters, noticing every detail in the room.
meanings.sent5: The spotter on the telescope helped astronomers find new stars in the sky.

meanings.definition: A group of individuals who assist in a particular activity.
meanings.sent1: The spotters on the relay team cheered on their teammates during the race.
meanings.sent2: The spotters in the control room guided the astronauts during the mission.
meanings.sent3: The baking spotters helped each other decorate the cupcakes.
meanings.sent4: The spotters in the search party worked together to find the lost hiker.
meanings.sent5: The spotters in the theater ensured the actors hit their marks on stage.
